forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind 14 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 45. Northwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
The afternoon has brought a mix of sun-scattered clouds and the lingering promise of rain, a combination that whispers of change in the air and hints at the fickleness of San Francisco weather. The brisk west winds stir the salty tang of the bay, setting a lively tone amid the coolness that has the city wrapped in an embrace hovering around 54 degrees. The golden hues of midday light struggle for dominance, flickering against the backdrop of the ever-present marine layer creeping in from the ocean, tending to obscure the more distant sculptures of the city skyline. As the day progresses, some rain showers are likely to slip in before four, which could leave behind just a trace—an apt reminder of the city's penchant for unpredictability.

As twilight descends, the clouds will meld into the soft blanket of night, with temperatures dipping down to about 45. A gentle northwest breeze offers a perfect opportunity to don a light jacket or a cozy sweater, ideal for an evening stroll through the dimly lit streets or relaxing with a book at one of the cafes with a view of the shimmering city lights. For those inclined toward quieter pursuits, an evening at a neighborhood gallery or a hidden bar might just suit the mood, lending an intimate touch to the cool air that wraps around the buildings and alleyways, creating a distinctive ambiance of San Francisco charm that is both reflective and inviting.
